comment: The weekday strike timetable is in place tomorrow ( the th of December ) as there is not enough time between two strike days to reinstate a full service . For full details and up to date timetables see <URL> please check before you travel .
amr:
# ::snt The weekday strike timetable is in place tomorrow ( the th of December ) as there is not enough time between two strike days to reinstate a full service . For full details and up to date timetables see <URL> please check before you travel .
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (ii / in-place
            :domain (t / timetable
                  :mod (s / strike-02
                        :time (w / weekday)))
            :time (t2 / tomorrow)
            :ARG1-of (c / cause-01
                  :ARG0 (t3 / time
                        :ARG1-of (h / have-quant-91
                              :polarity -
                              :ARG3 (e / enough)
                              :ARG6 (r / reinstate-01
                                    :ARG1 (s2 / serve-01
                                          :ARG1-of (f / full-09))
                                    :time (b / between
                                          :op1 (s3 / strike-02
                                                :quant 2)))))))
      :snt2 (s4 / see-01
            :mode imperative
            :polite +
            :ARG0 (y / you)
            :ARG1 (a / and
                  :op1 (d / detail
                        :ARG1-of (f2 / full-09))
                  :op2 t
                  :ARG1-of (u / up-to-date)))
      :time (b2 / before
            :op1 (t4 / travel-01
                  :ARG0 y)))

comment: I would love to know what these jobsworths are doing tomorrow if they re not striking , but the service is still reduced ? They all having a Christmas party ? Are there going to be guards per already crowded train ?
amr:
# ::snt I would love to know what these jobsworths are doing tomorrow if they re not striking , but the service is still reduced ? They all having a Christmas party ? Are there going to be guards per already crowded train ?
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (l / love-02
            :ARG0 (ii / i)
            :ARG1 (k / know-01
                  :ARG0 ii
                  :ARG1 (t / thing
                        :ARG1-of (d / do-02
                              :ARG0 (p / person
                                    :mod (j / jobsworth)
                                    :mod (t2 / this))
                              :condition (s / strike-02
                                    :polarity -
                                    :ARG0 p
                                    :time (t3 / tomorrow))
                              :concession-of (r / reduce-01
                                    :ARG1 (s2 / serve-01)
                                    :mod (s3 / still))))))
      :snt2 (p2 / party-01
            :ARG0 (t4 / they
                  :mod (a / all))
            :mod (f / festival
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "Christmas")))
      :snt3 (g / guard-01
            :ARG0 (t5 / train
                  :ARG1-of (c / crowd-01
                        :time (a2 / already)))
            :polarity (a3 / amr-unknown)))

comment: Hi Gary , the weekday strike timetable is in place on the th of December as there is not enough time between two strike days to reinstate a full service . You can find full details and up to date timetables here <URL> ^ MY
amr:
# ::snt Hi Gary , the weekday strike timetable is in place on the th of December as there is not enough time between two strike days to reinstate a full service . You can find full details and up to date timetables here <URL> ^ MY
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (s / say-01
            :ARG1 (h / hi)
            :ARG2 (p / person
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "Gary")))
      :snt2 (c / cause-01
            :ARG0 (t / time
                  :ARG1-of (h2 / have-quant-91
                        :polarity -
                        :ARG3 (e / enough)
                        :ARG6 (r / reinstate-01
                              :ARG1 (s2 / service
                                    :ARG1-of (f / full-09))

                                          :quant 2)
                                    :op2 (s4 / strike-02
                                          :quant (t2 / temporal-quantity
                                                :quant 2
                                                :unit (d / day))))))
                  :ARG1 (ii / in-place
                        :domain (t3 / timetable

      :snt3 (p2 / possible-01

            :location (h3 / here)))
